title: Boot NT systems On hard disk from a floppy

forumNotes.author: chenall
forumNotes.content:
Hi,  
this is my first post.  
I think this tools can help someoneã€‚  

this img can boot Windows NT SYSTEM (2000-2008) on hard disk When the system boot on the hard disk is broken  

the menu  
windows 2000-2003 is NT5.X  
windows VISTA/WIN7/WIN2008 is NT6.X  

Use:  
first Please copy files NTLDR,NTDETECT.COM(from windows 2003 sp1) and bootmgr (from win7 or Win2008) into ntboot.img  

1.grub4dos  
title Ntboot  
map --mem /ntboot.img.gz (fd0)  
map --hook  
chainloader (fd0)/grldr  
#or   
#rootnoverify (fd0)  
#chainloader +1  
2.syslinux  
kernel /memdisk.gz  
initrd /ntboot.img.gz  

Sorry my english,hope it's useful to you.  

2009-12-30  
modify menu.lst to find the right NT5.X system

forumNotes.author: Lancelot
forumNotes.content:
Hi chenall  

Thanks a lot for sharing,  
Here on boot-land we currently\* have some forum rules [here](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9101 "External link") which prevents us sharing undistributable files like Billy's files. (Example: ntldr, ntdetect.com, bootmgr in your package)  

For the cases where special files from Billy needed (or another..), you may write a tutorial or create a batcher (.cmd, winbuilder script etc) so users obtain files and follow the batcher or tutorial.  
It is not too hard, just provide ntboot.img without files mentioned, write which files needed (ex: ntdetect.com from 2k3sp1), provide a patcher to patch files (example: you may use wonderful patcher from nikzzzz [bPatch.exe](http://livexp.boot-land.net/Tools/LiveXP/bPatch.exe "External link")) and ask user to put these file inside ntboot.img (maybe with [imdisk](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=59 "External link") or...)  

This helps many users understand what is going on easly and makes developers support when available.  

:smile:
